page.title: 13GOLDHANGER - FISH STREET
page.content: Fish Street is called Fish Street because about 200 years ago fish was carried along it from the river.Fish Sreet leads from the Creek to the Square.N02 Fish Street used to be the only bakery in Goldhanger.It has a large bay window and extension at the back. The front of the house has horizontally hung boards. Next to the bakery is a house with the date 1720 above the door.The walls are lined with wattle and daub plastering. The "Creek",next door is a post war built house similar in style to the older ones.Most of the roofing tiles in Fish Street are hand made. My general impression of Fish Street is of a quiet lane where the new and old houses blend perfectly together.It is well worth a visit and would prove a most rewarding stroll for anyone interested in architecture.
